articles.description:
Blizzard Entertainment and NetEast Games have announced that the upcoming devilish MMOARPG Diablo Immortal is available for pre-load on PC today. As in, right now. It won't launch in full until next June 2nd, but Blizzard have provided a handy ‘roadmap’ for accessing the game here. Scurry forth ye demons.

 
Read more
articles.title: Diablo Immortal pre-load begins on PC today ahead of its launch on June 2nd

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
I’ve been keeping a curious eye on AMD’s Software Preview Driver for May 2022; GPU drivers often promise “optimisations” that are rarely felt in practice, but this one genuinely sounded like a performance enhancing drug for Radeon graphics cards. In a community post, AMD asserted this particular Preview Driver could provide double-digit percentage gains in games running DirectX 11; claims that were backed up by early independent testing, like the creator of benchmarking tool CapFrameX getting an extra 24% out of Crysis Remastered.


This week, AMD Software Adrenaline Edition 22.5.2 released, making that new Radeon driver available to anyone who didn’t fancy switching to preview builds. Armed with an RX 6500 XT (a low-end card that desperately needs a performance kick), I gave the new software a whirl – and found that, for all those big numbers, Radeon owners should probably lower their expectations.

 
Read more
articles.title: AMD Adrenalin driver 22.5.2 tested: big promises, but no GPU miracle worker

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
The word that comes to mind is "slick". In a genre defined by busy screens and showy light spectacles, Drainus does well to distinguish itself with such excellent animation. The enemies, and particularly the way they spill from levels like the battleship one, demonstrate some of the best sprite work I've seen for ages.
It's more than just stylish, too. As I've mentioned before, I'm bad enough at scrolling shooters, and outright averse to bullet hell, to make me less than an authority on which are the best. But Drainus held my attention for long enough that you should definitely give it a chance.
I'm not going to do a pun about the name. I'm not. I'm definitely not.
Read more
articles.title: Drainus isn't quite special, but sure is swish

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
A while back I finished Yakuza: Like A Dragon and felt a little bit lost. You know the feeling, right? When you snap shut a piece of fiction you’ve been reading for days, or months even, it can be difficult severing those relationships you’ve built with its characters. Unless there’s a direct sequel, you must pull your pants up and shelve those emotions and move on.
Not that I struggle with letting go of characters and stories particularly, but my brain makes an exception for the Yakuza games. More specifically, Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio's games. I’ve reached a point where I’m ordering Lost Judgment with no intention of playing it for months - maybe even a year? It’s all a ploy to hang onto RGG’s characters and worlds for as long as I can; a sort of buffer to keep the unease at bay. Having nowhere to turn to next isn’t an option.
Read more
articles.title: I've bought Lost Judgment with no intention of playing it

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
For about a week earlier this month, my inbox was absolutely rammed with emails from Team Fortress 2 players complaining about the game’s bot problem. I’d only just started this job and was still setting up my email signature at the time (sorry, TF2 community), but thankfully all that shouting has finally been heard by the people who matter most. For the first time in two years, Valve tweeted through the official TF2 account today that they’re finally going to do something about the bots. My inbox is thankful.

 
Read more
articles.title: Valve finally respond to Team Fortress 2’s bot problem

articles.author: Rebecca Jones
articles.description:
Genshin Impact will be back next week with its Version 2.7 update, which hit a three-week delay earlier this month. Among the headline new features anticipated in Phase I of the update is the addition of a new 5-star event-exclusive character, Hydro bow wielder Yelan. You'll be able to wish for her in the gacha from May 31st, but in the meantime, MiHoYo have set up a web event to let players get to know this mysterious newcomer a little bit better. Naturally, you'll be rewarded with in-game goodies (including Primogems) for taking part.
Read more
articles.title: Solve a mystery with new character Yelan in Genshin Impact's latest web event

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Mojang have revealed that Minecraft’s first major update of 2022, 1.19 The Wild, will arrive on June 7th to zhuzh up the game’s wildlife and biomes. There’ll also be some new aggressive mobs to contend with if you choose to venture down into the dark underground.

 
Read more
articles.title: Frogs are hopping aboard Minecraft in June with The Wild update

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Not long ago I attended a journo event in Paris, where game devs and their demo booths lined the walls. But none stood out quite like Clash: Artifacts Of Chaos, a third-person fighting adventure set in a punk-fantasy universe. Despite only the briefest of hands-on sessions cut short by sod's law, I simply can't shake the game from my short back and sides-furnished skull. I think I need someone to roundhouse kick me into reality, before I fall asleep and wake up in the fantastical reams of Zenozoik for good.
Read more
articles.title: Clash: Artifacts Of Chaos is a mind-bending brawler pulling no punches

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Valve have wheeled out another major Steam Deck software update, featuring some tasty changes that have been available to try on the SteamOS beta branch for a few weeks. Namely, SteamOS 3.2 tweaks the Deck’s fan curve to make it quieter (especially under light load), and adds the option to set the screen’s refresh rate anywhere between 40Hz and 60Hz – potentially saving battery life in exchange for a lower frames-per-second ceiling.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Steam Deck’s fan quietening, refresh rate customising OS update is out now

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Wordle is a puzzle game I play for a few minutes each day in order to relax. WeWordle, by comparison, isn't relaxing at all. It's a multiplayer variant where both players take it in turns to guess words on the same board, which means that each helpful guess you make is also helping your opponent.

 
Read more
articles.title: Compete to solve Wordle puzzles against others in WeWordle

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
BioShock: The Collection is the latest freebie on the Epic Games Store. Grab it anytime between now and June 2nd and BioShocks 1, 2 and Infinite are free to keep forever, including all the add-ons such as Minerva's Den and Burial At Sea.

 
Read more
articles.title: BioShock: The Collection is free to keep from Epic right now

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Survarium was one of several games that hoped to claim S.T.A.L.K.E.R's stalking hood after GSC Game World burst. Ten years after it was first announced and seven after it was released, developers Vostok Games say that Survarium's servers will go offline for the final time on May 31st.

 
Read more
articles.title: Survarium, spiritual successor to S.T.A.L.K.E.R., will shut down this month

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Sony mentioned in an investor call this week that a third of their first-party games would be on PC by 2025. Well, it looks like Returnal could be next in line to be ported across based on details in a new listing on SteamDB. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Returnal might be headed to PC, a new SteamDB listing suggests

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Gather round the fire, rogue likers and roguelike likers. In a moment of high folly, perhaps hubris, Unexplored 2 has arrived to these lands to preach the benefits of novelty and moreish dungeon delving. This is a chonker of a roguelike RPG, in which long-held assumptions about how the genre ought to be designed are thrown away, while others are strictly obeyed. The designers of this colourful 'splorer have rubbed their chins and decided to see what our beloved randomly generated death tales would look like without two sacred cows: money and meters. Folks, it looks kinda good.
Read more
articles.title: Unexplored 2: The Wayfarer's Legacy review: a special, chunky roguesomething

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
A digital artist has created a stylish mockup of a roguelike (maybe even a Roguelike) which looks like printed screenshots in a magazine. It's a pretty little thing, though I should stress it is only a mockup to demonstrate a shader, not an actual game. But still, come, watch.
Read more
articles.title: This cool roguelike mockup looks like screenshots printed in an old magazine

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Macek)
articles.description: Tento článek na za úkol ukázat, jak provádět některé operace s certifikáty a jak je automatizovat. Nebudeme se dnes zabývat věcmi jako certifikační autorita, kotva apod. Chci raději ukázat praktickou část.
articles.title: Certifikáty prakticky s utilitou OpenSSL: formáty, prohlížení, převody a testování

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Už jsme se již setkali s několika nástroji pro tvorbu grafů. Dnes se seznámíme s knihovnou Bokeh, která je určena pro tvorbu grafů v Pythonu, přičemž výsledkem je interaktivní webová stránka s „živým“ a interaktivním grafem.
articles.title: Tvorba interaktivních grafů pro webové stránky a aplikace s využitím knihovny Bokeh

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Michal Tauchman)
articles.description: V této kapitole se podíváme ve větším detailu na použité čipy a jejich základní vlastnosti. V druhé části článku zmíním první dojmy z provedení počítače a podíváme se na jeho možnosti konektivity.
articles.title: Projekt C64: čipová sada a první důkladné seznámení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si představíme jednoduchou aplikaci pro přenos souborů, zaznamenáme si pár poznámek, nalepíme si pár štítků a řekneme si o aplikaci pro sdílení zvuku.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (8. 6. 2022): jednoduchý přenos souborů mezi počítači

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: IPv6 je tu s námi oficiálně už deset let, v praxi ale ještě mnohem déle. Někdy to vypadá, že IPv6 vlastně nikdo nepotřebuje, kromě několika nadšenců. Je tomu ale skutečně tak? Nepotřebujeme nakonec IPv6 všichni?
articles.title: IPv6 deset let poté: kam jsme se dostali dekádu po velkém zapnutí?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Ve druhém článku o tvorbě her a grafických či zvukových dem pro osmibitovou herní konzoli NES se seznámíme s programátorským modelem mikroprocesoru MOS 6502 (resp. Ricoh 2A03.) a vysvětlíme si, jak vlastně skutečně pracuje kostra reálného programu pro NES.
articles.title: Základy tvorby her pro herní konzoli NES: mikroprocesor 6502 a assembler ca65

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CESNET CERTS)
articles.description: Dnes se dozvíte, jak infikovat počítač pouhým náhledem souboru nebo otevřením e-mailu, jak otevřít auto bez klíčků a také o úspěšném boji proti malware, který terorizoval mobilní zařízení.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: počítač infikovaný náhledem souboru či e-mailu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Unikla databáze s daty více než 20 tisíc uživatelů distribuce Linuxfx. Textový editor Gedit bude v Ubuntu 22.10 nahrazen GNOME Text Editorem. NixOS má nově grafický instalátor systému.
articles.title: Unikla databáze uživatelů Linuxfx, Ubuntu vymění textový editor

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Otevřený dopis za otevření kódu Intel Firmware Support Package (FSP), Wine 7.10 opravuje 17 let starou chybu-nechybu, KDE Plasma 5.25 stále ještě nehotová, Vivaldi 5.3 na bázi Chromia 102.
articles.title: Telefony Murena s /e/OS jsou v prodeji, Firefox 103 možná s akcelerací videa přes VA-API

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Ve čtvrtečních dopoledních hodinách došlo k velkému výpadku dodávky elektrické energie v Praze. Problém zasáhl i datacentrum MasterDC, kde se ale situace zkomplikovala natolik, že vypadly obě napájecí větve.
articles.title: Když zhasne datacentrum: vyjádření MasterDC k energetickému výpadku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Včera byla vydána aktualizovaná verze enterprisové distribuce SUSE Linux Enterprise 15 SP4 (SLES), dnes na ni navazuje komunitní edice openSUSE Leap 15.4, sestavovaná ze stejných zdrojů.
articles.title: Nové verze openSUSE Leap 15.4 a SLES 15 SP4

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Variabilní snímková frekvence jako součást běhu desktopového prostředí, je v projektu GNOME zas o krok blíž. Do kódu kompozitoru Mutter doputovaly příslušné patche, podpora VRR byla vyvíjena poslední dva roky.
articles.title: GNOME Mutter dostává podporu VRR

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Linuxových systémů přibývá, každý den se spouštějí nové servery a někdo se o ně musí starat. To znamená spoustu různých dovedností specifických právě pro linuxové prostředí. Jak to zprovoznit, kudy bezpečně dovnitř, co tam najdeme, jak se o to postaráme a jak to nastavíme nebo rozšíříme.
articles.title: Naučte se používat Linux správně a bezpečně (online školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Už tuto sobotu a neděli se můžete těšit na 32 zajímavých přednášek a 6 workshopů na dalším ročníku konference InstallFest. Konference o Linuxu, open-source a o všem, co s tím souvisí, je určena pro začátečníky i odborníky.
articles.title: InstallFest proběhne už tento víkend, přijďte na Karlovo náměstí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývojáři Intelu již pracují na podpoře přespříští 14. generace procesorů Intel Core, tedy Meteor Lake. Připomeňme, že v současnosti má od loňského listopadu Intel na trhu procesory Alder Lake a letos hodlá uvést jejich nástupce Raptor Lake. Teprve poté přijde výše zmíněný Meteor Lake, a to nejdříve v mobilních verzích, o které tu v Corebootu primárně jde, desktopy až několik měsíců poté.
articles.title: Coreboot dostává patche s podporou Intel Meteor Lake

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Správce české národní domény rozšířil svoji spolupráci se společností Internet Multifeed, která provozuje JPNAP, největší peeringový uzel v Asijsko-pacifickém regionu, v němž sdružení CZ.NIC provozuje sekundární jmenný server. Na základě dodatku ke společnému memorandu z roku 2011 došlo během uplynulých měsíců nejen k upgradu hardware DNS serveru, ale také ke zvýšení kapacity jeho připojení, díky čemuž se zlepšila dostupnost české národní domény pro uživatele z regionu východní Asie. Upgrade tohoto uzlu je součástí periodické údržby DNS anycastu české národní domény.
articles.title: CZ.NIC posílil DNS anycast v japonském Tokiu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Apple nadále pokračuje v převodu svých počítačů z architektury Intel x86_64 na vlastní 64bit čipy Apple Silicon (aktuální řada M1 a čerstvě ohlášená M2). Firma nyní s novým vydáním macOS 13 připravila možnost běhu intelovských binárek pro architekturu x86_64 na svých ARM čipech, a to za pomoci vrstvy Rosetta a virtuálního stroje postaveného na Linuxu. Podrobně vše popisuje Apple na svém webu.
articles.title: Nový macOS 13 přidává podporu běhu x86_64 binárek na Apple M1/M2 díky vrstvě Rosetta

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Druhá generace 5nm procesu TSMC a 20 miliard tranzistorů, to jsou dva klíčové parametry, které předurčují výkon nového ARM SoC pro počítače Apple. Nakousnuté jablko posouvá dál hranice, nový procesor nabízí propustnost 128bit LPDDR5 paměťového subsystému na 100 GB/s (adresovat umí až 24 GB RAM), kombinaci 4+4 CPU jader (4 výkonná, 4 efektivní).
articles.title: Apple ohlásil procesor M2, výkon narostl až o 35 %

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Server Phoronix dnes otestoval výkon Pythonu 3.11 Beta 1, který vyšel minulý měsíc. Python 3.11 by již měl zahrnovat zrychlení z projektu „Faster CPython Project“. Podle oficiálního testu pyperformance je 3.11 o 25 % rychlejší než 3.10. Ale podle druhu zátěže lze očekávat zrychlení v rozmezí 10–60 %.
articles.title: Python 3.11 beta 1 ukazuje podstatné zrychlení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Alternativa k počítači v klávesnici Raspberry Pi 400 od čínského výrobce Orange Pi se jmenuje Orange Pi 800. Je postavena na CPU Rockchip RK3399 (šest jader, 2× Cortex-A72 1,8 GHz a 4× Cortex-A53 1,4 GHz) a obsahuje 4 GB RAM, 64 GB eMMC a microSD kartu, HDMI výstup s rozlišením 4k a VGA výstup s rozlišením FullHD.
articles.title: Orange Pi 800: počítač v klávesnici a alternativa k Raspberry Pi 400

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Do jádra 5.19 se dostala záplata od Thomase Gleixnera a Borislava Petkova, která ve výchozím stavu vypíná pozdní nahrávání mikrokódu, protože to v některých případech nefunguje a jedná se tedy o loterii. Tato konfigurace MICROCODE_OLD_INTERFACE (deprecated) je přejmenována na MICROCODE_LATE_LOADING (dangerous). Pozdní aktualizace mikrokódu používala /dev/cpu/microcode a nástroje iucode_tool nebo microcode.ctl. Nově bude při použití pozdní aktualizace jádro také označeno (tainted).
articles.title: Pozdní nahrávání mikrokódu pro x86 je pokládáno za loterii

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Zálohovací software Timeshift je podobný jako Time Machine pro macOS nebo System Restore ve Windows. Používá buď rsync a hardlinky, nebo BTRFS snapshoty. Od běžných zálohovacích programů se liší v tom, že zálohuje jen operační systém a ne soubory uživatelů.
articles.title: Linux Mint převezme vývoj zálohovacího software Timeshift

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Staré Apple iPady s procesory A7 a A8 z let 2013–2014 již nedostávají žádné aktualizace od Apple, ale dva nadšenci Konrad Dybcio a quaack723 dokázali na nich spustit jádro 5.18. Použitá byla distribuce postmarketOS, která je odvozena od Alpine Linuxu a je používána hlavně na zařízeních s Androidem.
articles.title: Na starých Apple iPadech s procesory A7 a A8 běží Linux

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: V polovině června navštíví Prahu Gil Tene – spoluzakladatel a CTO firmy Azul, která vyvíjí vlastní implementaci platformy Java. V Praze se zúčastní dvou meetupů, na kterých přednese přednášky
articles.title: Pozvánka na přednášky Java After Eight a Java at Speed

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Před dvěma týdny jsme informovali, že vývojář software pro odstranění šumu z mikrofonu NoiseTorch měl podezření, že s kódem mohlo být manipulováno. Komunita zdrojový kód podrobila auditu a nic nebezpečného nenašla.
articles.title: NoiseTorch 0.12.0, audit nic špatného neobjevil

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Mozilla pracuje na offline překladači Bergamot již od roku 2019 spolu s univerzitami v Edinburku, Sheffieldu, Tartu a Karlovou univerzitou v Praze. Projekt byl podporován EU. Včera byla oznámena dostupnost rozšíření pro Firefox s názvem Firefox Translation.
articles.title: Vydán nástroj pro offline překlad Bergamot od Mozilly

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Chceš začít s programováním? Python je oblíbený programovací jazyk mezi vývojáři i zaměstnavateli a zároveň super vstupenka do světa programování. Nauč se přemýšlet jako programátor a efektivně využívat Python na řešení nejrůznějších problémů. Online Python Akademie znamená celkem 12 týdnů, vždy jedna lekce týdně, večer od 18:00 do 21:00. Následující kurz začíná 16. června.
articles.title: Online Python Akademie: začněte s programováním v oblíbeném jazyce (online kurz)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Ubuntu 21.10 Impish Indri vyšlo už před devíti měsíci (článek na Rootu) a jelikož jde o běžné vydání s krátkou životností, blíží se nyní konec jeho podpory. Ten byl ohlášen na 14. června a po tomto datu přestanou vycházet bezpečnostní aktualizace. Uživatelé by tedy měli brzy aktualizovat, podporovaná je cesta přes Ubuntu 22.04 LTS.
articles.title: Ubuntu 21.10 Impish Indri končí s podporou 14. června

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V dopoledních hodinách proběhl v Praze rozsáhlý výpadek dodávek elektřiny způsobený výpadkem páteřního zařízení ČEPS na Chodově. Výpadek trval asi dvě hodiny, během kterých byl například částečně omezen provoz tramvají a pražského metra. Zároveň však došlo k poruše na jedné napájecí větvi v datacentru Master Internet, kde běží například také servery společnosti Internet Info včetně Root.cz.
articles.title: Výpadek v datacentru Master Internet vyřadil spoustu služeb včetně Root.cz

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Odborníci z nadace Shadow Server proskenovali internet a hledali přitom otevřené TCP porty 3306, na kterých může poslouchat MySQL server. Objevili přitom více než 3,6 milionů instalací, které odpovídaly na jejich dotazy. Takto otevřený přístup k serveru může vytvářet potenciální prostor pro útočníky.
articles.title: Více než 3,6 milionů serverů MySQL je dostupných z internetu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Příští týden, konkrétně v úterý 7. června, končí podpora pro Fedoru 34. Po tomto datu už nebudou k dispozici žádné aktualizace, včetně těch bezpečnostních. Pokud tuto verzi stále ještě používáte, měli byste brzy aktualizovat na některé z novějších vydání.
articles.title: Fedora 34 bude od příštího týdne bez podpory

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Projekt Linux Vendor Firmware Service (LVFS) běží něco přes pět let. V roce předposledním skrze něj bylo instalováno zhruba 25 miliónů nových firmwarů a Richard Hughes z Red Hatu, který vývoj LVFS vede, hlásí z konference Embedded Recipes 2022, že loňský rok zvýšil celkový počet instalovaných firmwarů skrze LVFS na 52,1 miliónů. Úspěšnost instalací pak přesahuje 99 %
articles.title: LVFS v roce 2021: přes 52 miliónů instalovaných firmwarů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: bkralik)
articles.description: Měsíc utekl lusknutím prstu a krom konference InstallFest se nám přiblížila i další Virtuální Bastlírna. Chcete vědět, co za zajímavé novinky a zvláštní témata pro vás organizátoři našli tentokrát?
articles.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 15: předinstallfestová

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: GNOME bylo první velké desktopové prostředí, které přešlo na Wayland. A pokud bychom si měli vsadit, které jako první jednoho dne zcela přestane podporovat X11 a také XWayland, bude to opět GNOME. První krok už nastal, vedle existující vývojové větve kompozitoru GNOME Mutter „without-xwayland“ probíhá restrukturalizace kódu, která mimo jiné umožní sestavit Mutter zcela bez závislostí rodiny X11.
articles.title: GNOME záměrně zcela bez X11 / Xwaylandu: experiment již běží

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Už příští měsíc bude představen první telefon s 200Mpix snímačem hlavního foťáčků. Čínská pobočka Motoroly neudržela pokličku na místě.
articles.title: Smartphone Motorola s 200Mpix fotoaparátem už příští měsíc

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled květnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za květen 2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Vědci přišli na levnou výrobu nejlepšího grafenu. Umělá inteligence od Konica Minolta dokáže sledovat spokojenost zákazníků. Proč 85 % organizací do roku 2025 nasadí kontejnery? Poptávka po odbornících na kyberbezpečnost strmě roste, stejně tak i jejich platy. Dodavatelé alternativních cloudů na svou šanci teprve čekají.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Dodavatelé alternativních cloudů na svou šanci teprve čekají

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 22/2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Za kolik antihmoty může běžná hmota? Zbývá něco na temnou? Nejsilnější marsotřesení. Ceres měl vzniknout až za Saturnem. Z atomů uhlíku sestavili Möbiovu pásku. Diamantová zrcadla pro výkonné lasery.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Zpřesnili hodnotu Hubbleovy konstanty, problém ale trvá

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Supernabídka od Goodoffer24 pokračuje i v červnu! Nejzajímavější z nabídek je bezpochyby doživotní licence na Windows 10 za pouhých € 11, u které připomínáme, že vám dovoluje upgradovat na Windows 11 zdarma! Hovoříme přitom o doživotní licenci, u které vám garantujeme výměnu 30 dní od nákupu v případě, že by se vyskytl nějaký problém. Také potvrzujeme excelentní nabídky na balíky Office ve verzi 2016, které můžete koupit za € 23 s doživotní licencí.
articles.title: Doživotní licence na Windows 10 za € 11, Office za € 23, v červnu s námi ušetříte až 91 %!

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Jak jsme na tom s řízením kybernetické bezpečnosti. Broadcom převezme VMware za 61 miliard dolarů. Nový IT normál? Cloudové služby, edge computing a automatizace. Téměř polovina finančních ředitelů považuje samoobslužná data a analytiku za hnací sílu produktivity zaměstnanců. Elektroniku čeká další zdražování, zejména kvůli růstu cen čipů. Zdokonalovat lze i kvantové simulátory.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Zdokonalovat lze i kvantové simulátory

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 21/2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Vznik života a kvantové tečky. Hledání Dysonových sfér u bílých trpaslíků. Poprvé syntetizovali materiál při tlaku, jaký panuje v jádru Uranu. Drony mohou rozsypávat bezdrátové senzory.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: V CERNu změřili hmotnost kvarku c

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Mezi základní návyky lidí s pokročilou úrovní finanční gramotnosti patří investování přebytečných financí do výnosných aktiv. Jak ale s investováním začít a na jaká rizika si dát pozor? Poradíme vám v dnešním článku.
articles.title: Creditas: Jak začít investovat a na co si dát pozor?

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Microsoft Teams zvládá automatický zápis schůzek. Hewlett Packard Enterprise v Česku staví nový výrobní závod na superpočítače. Acer omladí pracovní notebooky TravelMate P4, TravelMate Spin P4 a TravelMate P2. Pure dále zpřístupňuje podnikům Kubernetes. Zasuneš a jedeš. Kubernetes: obliba roste, problém zůstává bezpečnost a know-how. O financování většiny podnikového IT se rozhoduje (i) mimo IT oddělení.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: O financování většiny podnikového IT se rozhoduje (i) mimo IT oddělení

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Magnetické pole si může převrátit i černá díra. V atmosféře přibývá helia, je tam víc i izotopu 3He. Další teorie postuluje neexistenci času. Simulace NASA ukazují, že sopky mohou klima i oteplovat. Účinný vodíkový palivový článek se obejde bez drahých kovů.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: 2D materiál dokáže uchovávat qubity při pokojové teplotě

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Třetí den konference SUSECON Digital 2022, třetí videoklip od SUSE: We Didn't Start the Kernel - A SUSE Music Parody.
articles.title: We Didn't Start the Kernel - A SUSE Music Parody

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: GitHub oznámil ukončení vývoje open source editoru Atom (Wikipedie).
articles.title: GitHub oznámil ukončení vývoje editoru Atom

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová stabilní verze 3.2 svobodného 3D softwaru Blender. Přehled novinek v oznámení o vydání a na YouTube.
articles.title: Blender 3.2

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 2.4.54 svobodného multiplatformního webového serveru Apache (httpd). Řešeno je mimo jiné  8 bezpečnostních chyb.
articles.title: Apache HTTP Server (httpd) 2.4.54 řeší 8 bezpečnostních chyb

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Po roce od vydání verze 15.3 bylo vydáno openSUSE Leap 15.4. Přehled novinek v nejnovější verzi této linuxové distribuce v oznámení o vydání a v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: openSUSE Leap 15.4

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Druhý den konference SUSECON Digital 2022, druhý videoklip od SUSE: Remember When - A SUSE Music Parody.
articles.title: Remember When - A SUSE Music Parody

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: PeerTube (Wikipedie), svobodná decentralizovaná platforma pro sdílení a přehrávání videí, byla vydána ve verzi 4.2.0. Přehled novinek i s náhledy v oficiálním oznámení. Zdůrazněna je například možnost úprav videí přímo ve webovém rozhraní PeerTube.
articles.title: PeerTube 4.2.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 4.6.0 open source multiplatformní knihovny OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision, Wikipedie) určené pro zpracování obrazu a počítačové vidění. Přehled novinek v ChangeLogu.
articles.title: OpenCV 4.6.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Počítačová hra Minecraft (Wikipedie) byla vydána ve verzi 1.19 aneb The Wild Update. Edice Bedrock a Java se nově prodávají společně. Oficiální trailer na YouTube.
articles.title: Minecraft 1.19 The Wild Update

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: GZDoom (Wikipedie) byl vydán ve verzi 4.8.0. Jedná se o open source port enginu počítačové hry Doom vycházející z portu ZDoom.
articles.title: GZDoom 4.8.0

articles.description: As added reason for Radeon Linux users to celebrate today beyond Blender 3.2 releasing with AMD HIP Linux render support is that Mesa's Radeon Vulkan driver "RADV" continues maturing with its ray-tracing support...
articles.title: Mesa 22.2 RADV Driver Adds Vulkan Ray-Tracing Maintenance Extension

articles.description: Blender 3.2 is releasing this morning as the newest version of this open-source, cross-platform 3D modeling and animation software package. Blender 3.2 finally adds AMD GPU-accelerated rendering support on Linux and many other refinements...
articles.title: Blender 3.2 Debuts With AMD GPU Linux Rendering Support

articles.description: Following yesterday's release of SUSE Linux Enterprise 15 SP4, today the openSUSE community has released openSUSE Leap 15.4 that is free and built from the same shared sources as SLE 15 SP4...
articles.title: openSUSE Leap 15.4 Released

articles.description: Last month I published a review on the TUXEDO Aura 15 Gen2 laptop that is powered by an AMD Ryzen 5000 series SoC and initially shipped with Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. But with Ubuntu 22.04 LTS now having been released -- and TUXEDO Computers shifting over to Ubuntu 22.04 LTS -- here is a look at the performance uplift that can be expected from this new Ubuntu long-term support version.
articles.title: Ubuntu 22.04 Ups The Performance For TUXEDO's AMD Ryzen Linux Laptop

articles.description: In addition to Intel already starting work on Meteor Lake enablement in Coreboot, this week Intel open-source engineers have also been submitting more code for Raptor Lake as the CPUs expected later this year as the successor to Alder Lake...
articles.title: Intel Prepares Raptor Lake Code For Coreboot

articles.description: The GNU C Library (Glibc) now has a memory copy (memcpy) implementation optimized for Arm's Scalable Vector Extension (SVE) that can "significantly" improve performance...
articles.title: Glibc Adds Arm SVE-Optimized Memory Copy - Can "Significantly" Help Performance

articles.description: The SDL library that is widely used by cross-platform games as a software/hardware abstraction layer has merged support for the Chinese LoongArch CPU architecture...
articles.title: SDL Adds Initial Support For LoongArch

articles.description: For those making use of the lighttpd lightweight and speedy web server, a new release is now available of this BSD-licensed open-source software. Most notable with lighttpd 1.4.65 is support for WebSockets over HTTP/2...
articles.title: lighttpd 1.4.65 Released With WebSockets Over HTTP/2

articles.description: Variable rate refresh (VRR / FreeSync / Adaptive-Sync) support for GNOME's Mutter compositor is closer to being merged. The native back-end support for VRR that has been in development the past two years is no longer considered a work-in-progress and it's believed there are no longer any blocking issues that would prevent this code from landing...
articles.title: GNOME's Mutter Variable Rate Refresh Support Closer To Being Merged

articles.description: The real-time (RT) patch series still hasn't been mainlined but the patch delta is slowly winding down with each new kernel version. Out today is the re-based RT patch series for the recently minted Linux 5.19-rc1 with some of the prior real-time patches having been upstreamed this merge window and other patches re-based to work with the newest kernel code...
articles.title: RT Patches Updated For Linux 5.19-rc1 - Real-Time Inches Closer To The Finish Line

articles.description: Last month RHEL 9.0 reached GA as the newest major update to Red Hat Enterprise Linux. Since then I've been trying out RHEL 9.0 on a few servers. To little surprise, especially for latest-generation Intel Xeon Scalable and AMD EPYC servers, RHEL 9.0 is offering significant uplift compared to the existing RHEL8 series. Here are some Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.0 benchmarks comparing the performance to RHEL 8.6.
articles.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.0 Performing Well, Great Benefit To Newer Intel Xeon & AMD EPYC Servers

articles.description: In kicking off SUSECON, SUSE has announced the release of SUSE Linux Enterprise 15 Service Pack 4. Notable with SLE 15 SP4, SUSE is already switching to using NVIDIA's open-source GPU kernel-mode driver that NVIDIA open-sourced last month and is under active development and has a long road ahead before it's even feasible for upstreaming into the mainline kernel...
articles.title: SUSE Linux Enterprise 15 SP4 Released - Switches To NVIDIA's Open Kernel Driver, Adds AMD SEV-ES

articles.description: Intel Meteor Lake as the successor to Raptor Lake has begun seeing Coreboot enablement work by Intel engineers...
articles.title: Intel Begins Adding Meteor Lake Support To Coreboot

articles.description: While Docker can already run on AArch64 Linux, the mainline Linux kernel's default configuration "defconfig" lacks a few features for allowing it to run out-of-the-box. An Arm engineer is proposing adjusting those defaults to make it more easily/straight-forward to run Docker on 64-bit Arm...
articles.title: Arm Looking To Make It Easier To Run Docker On AArch64 Linux

articles.description: Somewhat surprisingly, the open-source SDL library that is widely used by games for cross-platform handling and abstracting of various software interfaces has added a Microsoft DirectX 12 renderer...
articles.title: SDL Adds A DirectX 12 Renderer Backend

articles.description: Ikey Doherty started the Solus Linux distribution then disappeared and wrote an open letter on Phoronix about his absence, also was employed by Intel for a year to work on their Clear Linux distribution, had a brief stint starting a game/software development company, and then started the Serpent OS Linux distribution. He's still been working on Serpent OS but then was working full-time elsewhere but now has decided to return full-time to working on his latest Linux distribution...
articles.title: Ikey Doherty Returning To Work Full-Time On Serpent OS Linux Distribution

articles.description: In addition to announcing the M2 SoC, Apple used its WWDC keynote to also announce macOS 13 "Ventura". One of the interesting technical changes with macOS 13 is the ability to use Apple's Rosetta software for speedy execution of Linux x86_64 binaries running on ARM Linux VMs from Apple Silicon...
articles.title: macOS 13 Adding Ability To Use Rosetta In ARM Linux VMs For Speedy x86_64 Linux Binaries

articles.description: Apple's WWDC keynote this year was used to announce the M2 processor alongside a slew of other announcements...
articles.title: Apple Announces Its New M2 Processor

articles.description: Last month Python 3.11 Beta 1 was released as their first preview of this major update to the Python programming language. Besides new language features and other improvements, Python 3.11 performance is looking fantastic with very nice performance uplift over prior Python 3.x releases.
articles.title: Python 3.11 Performance Benchmarks Are Looking Fantastic

articles.description: In addition to Mesa's Radeon "RADV" Vulkan driver prepared for mesh shading with an upcoming Vulkan mesh shader extension besides NVIDIA's NV_mesh_shader, it looks like AMD will be punctually supporting the cross-vendor mesh shader extension too...
articles.title: Open-Source AMDVLK Vulkan Driver Preparing Mesh Shader Support

articles.description: With Panfrost Gallium3D patches landing today into Mesa 22.2 and Panfrost DRM kernel driver support slated to land for the Linux 5.20 cycle later this summer, the Mali G57 GPU has conformant OpenGL ES 3.1 support on this open-source driver and the first Mali GPU of the Valhall generation to have this achievement following the Panfrost driver's successes for the older Bifrost and Midgard architectures...
articles.title: Linux 5.20 + Mesa 22.2 To Allow Conformant Mali G57 OpenGL ES 3.1 Support

articles.description: With the Linux 5.19 merge window complete, here is my usual look at all of the interesting changes I've been watching for this next version of the Linux kernel. Linux 5.19 is quite a big summer time upgrade to this open-source kernel with many new and improved features coming for this kernel that will debut as stable in late July.
articles.title: Linux 5.19 Features: AMD SEV-SNP + Zen 4 Prep, Intel TDX + IFS, LoongArch, Big TCP, Apple M1 NVMe

articles.description: A last minute change sent in on Sunday and merged prior to Linux 5.19-rc1 disables late microcode loading by default for x86/x86_64 processors over its sad state of affairs...
articles.title: Linux 5.19 Frowns On x86/x86_64 Late Microcode Loading - "It's Just Lottery & Broken"

articles.description: It's not only the Linux kernel that's been seeing some spring cleaning but Mesa developers have also been quite busy on working to remove some old, poorly maintained code from their open-source 3D driver components...
articles.title: More Old GLSL Code Is Gutted From Mesa 22.2

articles.description: It was eighteen years ago today that I started Phoronix.com to focus on Linux hardware reviews. Back then it was difficult getting peripherals working under Linux from 56k modems to printers and other components today where Linux support can just be assumed. Open-source graphics drivers back then were also in their infancy and lacking vendor support while NVIDIA was well regarded then for their proprietary driver being at least featureful and performant. It's been quite a journey...
articles.title: Phoronix Turns 18 Years Old For Covering Linux Hardware

articles.description: Following a rather eventful Linux 5.19 merge window the past two weeks, Linus Torvalds just released Linux 5.19-rc1. It's a great way coincidentally to mark the end of the Phoronix 18th birthday...
articles.title: Linux 5.19-rc1 Released With Intel TDX, AMD SEV-SNP, LoongArch, Big TCP & A Lot More

articles.description: While just a day prior Linus Torvalds was questioning the proposed "HTE" subsystem, today on this final day of the Linux 5.19 merge window he decided to land this new subsystem...
articles.title: Hardware Timestamping Engine Subsystem Merged For Linux 5.19

articles.description: Greg Kroah-Hartman on Friday sent in the USB/Thunderbolt updates for the Linux 5.19 kernel that is seeing its merge window end today. With the USB updates, Greg had some remarks on the DWC3 Linux driver that will likely "never be finished" given that this USB IP is appearing in lots of hardware but not consistently being implemented and thus continuing to require a lot of adaptations on the driver side...
articles.title: Popular USB DWC3 Linux Driver Likely To "Never Be Finished" With Continued Adaptations

articles.description: Last month Microsoft published their first production release of CBL-Mariner 2.0 as an updated version of their in-house Linux distribution used for a variety of purposes from Windows Subsystem for Linux to Azure. This week Microsoft released a rather hefty stable update to their CBL-Mariner 2.0 distribution...
articles.title: Microsoft Ships Big Update To Their CBL-Mariner 2.0 Linux Distribution

articles.description: Greg Kroah-Hartman on Friday submitted the "char/misc" changes for the Linux 5.19 kernel. Char/misc continues to be the "catch all" area of the kernel for drivers and code not fitting formally within other kernel subsystems. Leading on this front for Linux 5.19 is the introduction of the Apple eFuse driver for M1 systems and Intel-owned Habana Labs continues improving their AI accelerator driver...
articles.title: Apple eFuse Driver, Intel Habana Labs Driver Improvements Lead char/misc In Linux 5.19

articles.description: FEX-Emu 2206 has been released as the newest version of this user-space, open-source software for being able to run x86/x86_64 applications and games on AArch64 (Arm) hardware...
articles.title: FEX-Emu 2206 Released For Enjoying x86/x86_64 Apps & Games On Arm

articles.description: While there has been progress with the Mesa code targeting Apple M1 to run basic tests like glmark2, that has traditionally been an effort running under macOS with its kernel driver. This week the Asahi Linux crew celebrated their first rendered triangle running with a fully open-source driver stack...
articles.title: Asahi Linux Celebrates First Triangle On The Apple M1 With Fully Open-Source Driver

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
The following contains spoilers for Episode 2 of the BioShock Infinite DLC Burial at Sea. Proceed at your own risk.
It's like I'm really there
One of the things I love about games is how much they lean into genre fiction. Games have never been afraid to lean hard into sci-fi, fantasy, westerns, apocalypse stories, and so on. This means we get a lot of stories that stand out with their unique characters, mechanics, and lore, but one of my favorite aspects of games has to be how settings take on a whole personality of their own. Rather than serving as a backdrop for the action, so many game settings take a front seat in the story, driving home its themes and moving the plot forward.
Perhaps my favorite example of great settings in games comes from the BioShock series. Cities like Rapture and…
articles.title: Video game settings are characters of their own

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
Early development underway with Unreal Engine 5
Not to be confused with a certain high-profile Super Smash Bros. Brawl mod, Project M from NCSOFT is an upcoming Unreal Engine 5-developed, console-bound "interactive movie experience" with an eye-catching trailer. I can't say I'm exactly picturing a full-fledged game yet from this limited proof-of-concept, but the premise of a "man seeking vengeance" — combined with these high production values — speaks to me.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1SApk_2ktfg
The footage is heavy on the "is revenge ever really worth it" theme? and shows a few action sequences that would look at home in one of Supermassive's cinematic horror adventures like The Quarry. For some players, there's not enough interactivity, but I don't mind as long as the pacing is tig…
articles.title: Project M is NCSOFT’s new cinematic revenge game

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
You could help test the long-awaited online campaign co-op
Halo fans who have been waiting for Infinite to get some campaign co-op might not have to wait much longer. 343 Industries announced its going to test out online Halo Infinite campaign co-op in July.
The test flight will be for Halo insiders, 343's program for experimenting and getting feedback on Halo games. These public flights offer a chance to test things out, stress them a bit, and provide some feedback to the team.
If you're hoping to get some network co-op in, you're able to sign up for the program here on the Halo Waypoint.
https://twitter.com/Halo/status/1534233991972257792
Keep in mind, this is just the insider test that's rolling out in July. 343 Industries is still targeting later this year for the official launch of campaign co-op. And note that that's network campaign co-op, too, so no split-screen just yet.
Carrying on the fight
Campaign co-op has been an elusive addition for Halo Infinite. First it slipped the launch window, then was pushed into 2022, and now it seems to be aiming for an August launch.
The Forge, Halo's extensive custom map and content creation tool, has also been pushed back a few times as well. At least with test flighting on the way for co-op, odds seem good that 343 Industries is closing in on a launch.
That might help 343 set a better tone for Halo Infinite moving forward too. The post-launch rollout has had some bumps, with the team acknowledging a "bumpy start" to Halo Infinite Season 2 last month.
Campaign co-op and the Halo series are synonymous for me, so it's safe to say that the full launch of online campaign co-op would definitely get me to boot Infinite back up. The latest Halo has been something I enjoy going back to every couple of months for a few quick matches of Team Slayer and Big Team Battle, but I'd love to see 343 finally roll out the heavy hitters it's been working on.
The post Halo Infinite campaign co-op testing will start in July appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Halo Infinite campaign co-op testing will start in July

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
The heroes get back in action
After some time away, an unlikely band of heroes is returning. Marvel's Midnight Suns will return for tomorrow's Summer Game Fest stream.
The news was shared on social media today, confirming a new look at Midnight Suns will be in the Summer Game Fest Live show. SGF kicks off on June 9 at 11 am. PT / 2 p.m. ET.
https://twitter.com/midnightsuns/status/1534566300889952256
The social account for Midnight Suns is also doing a skin code giveaway for the game. Liking or retweeting this post will net you a code for a new hero being revealed during tomorrow's event. I can verify it works, though it didn't give me any hints as to who it's for in the message.
Marvel's Midnight Suns was revealed last year as the heavily rumored tactical Marvel game. It's being developed …
articles.title: Marvel’s Midnight Suns will reappear at Summer Game Fest Live 2022

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
The Next Generation... Again!
Since last week's gameplay reveal for Street Fighter 6, spotlit as a part of Sony's State of Play showcase, publisher Capcom has been drip-feeding new clips and info regarding the flashy-looking fighting sequel.
We've already seen — and I should add officially seen — footage on several new and familiar faces in action, and even gotten a sneak peek at the new fight intros and interactive Vs screens. In regards to lore, Capcom has also confirmed that Street Fighter 6 is set after Street Fighter III, and thus represents the most recent chronological entry in the lore of the World Warriors.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GZud-p0QRvA
But what of the two officially announced newcomers, Luke Sullivan and Jamie... Something? What part will they have to play in the ne…
articles.title: Street Fighter 6: Will Luke and Jamie strike harder than former fighting rivals?

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
Those items are staying put
Activision is unveiling more details about its next Call of Duty today. Amid the Modern Warfare II news, there were also some new details about the upcoming Warzone experience, dubbed Warzone 2.0. It'll be using new tech and gameplay, and that means some old stuff like player inventory will need to stay in the old Warzone.
Development on the new Warzone experience will take the game into the same engine behind Modern Warfare II itself. As part of this, Warzone 2.0 will feature new content and systems with "brand-new progression and inventories."
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r72GP1PIZa0
Warzone 2.0 is set to launch later this year, sometime between the launch of Modern Warfare II on Oct. 28 and the end of the calendar year. But if you want to keep playing with…
articles.title: Call of Duty: Warzone inventory won’t carry over into Warzone 2.0

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
Same name, whole new game
The Call of Duty series has seen a lot of changes over the years. With every entry in the series, the franchise evolves in one way or another, especially with three different studios to make their own mark on the series' legacy. Now with the October 28 release of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare II (not to be confused with the 2009 game with the same name), Activision is looking to overhaul the series by adding a whole host of new features to go along with the reboot, as reported by Polygon.
A new engine
Probably the biggest change coming for Call of Duty is a brand new engine. Because the CoD games are developed separately by three different studios -- Sledgehammer Games, Infinity Ward, and Treyarch -- Activision wanted to make sure that all of the games moving forwa…
articles.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare II brings the series into a new era

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
John Smith, 1882?
Focus Entertainment has announced an official release date for its gory, gothic shooter Evil West. This grisly and alternate take on undead life in the American Frontier will hit PC and console platforms September 20.
Developed by studio Flying Wild Hog, who sure know their way around an exploding head or three, Evil West sees players don the hat and poncho of a lone gunslinger, one of the last remaining members of a clandestine monster-hunting society. As a terrifying and bloodthirsty battalion of vampires, ghoulies, and legions of the undead emerges to lay waste to the Old West, it is up to our hero to lay down a law that goes way beyond a sheriff's badge, and put these decaying varmints back in the ground. Permanently.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2O35NOsTIoE
One or two players can saddle up for a hyper-violent campaign that will follow our outlaws as they forge a path through America's formative towns, cities, and wildlands, facing off against an army of ungodly creatures and offering all a date with oblivion. In typical Flying Wild Hog fashion, Evil West is loaded for bear with a huge arsenal of explosive, anachronistic weaponry, while players will also earn perks and upgrades to help turn the tide of battle in their favor.
It's a really cool setup, and I'm liking what I'm seeing in both the chaotic, cathartic gameplay and the atmospheric old-west-horror cutscenes. Evil West already looks to be one of those titles that might not be making a huge impact on the radars of the gaming community, but will prove to be one of the year's slickest and most compelling shooter experiences.
Evil West launches September 20 on PlayStation, PC, and Xbox platforms.
The post Evil West brings its gory gunslinging to PC and consoles in September appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Evil West brings its gory gunslinging to PC and consoles in September

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Ai-Ho, check this out
Atlus is gearing up for the launch of its kinetic and stylish-looking sequel Soul Hackers 2, which is coming to PlayStation, PC, and Xbox platforms this summer — and for those of you hardened hacker-heads, the publisher has also revealed a cool, (and somewhat pricey), collector's edition.
The Soul Hackers 2 Collector's Edition, which will be made available to western audiences, includes a physical copy of the game on the platform of your choice, along with several fun additions including an exclusive SteelBook case, a digital soundtrack on a themed USB stick, art cards, a pin badge set, and a Shark key chain, the centerpieces of this edition are a three-inch figurine of the series iconic mascot Ai-Ho, and a cute plushie of Mimi. The set will retail for $199.99 USD.
If you're interested in bagging this special edition, then you should mark your calendars for Friday, June 10 at 10:00 PT / 13:00 ET, for this is when Atlus will open pre-orders over on the official Shop Atlus store. The Collector's Edition is an online store exclusive and Atlus suggests that quantities for each platform are limited, so set your watch and be online when the pre-orders go live to ensure that you get your name down. While I think the pricing is pretty steep, I have to admit that Mimi plush is very cute.
Soul Hackers 2 launches August 26 on PlayStation, PC, and Xbox platforms.
The post Soul Hackers 2 is getting a totes adorbs (if pricey) collector’s edition appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Soul Hackers 2 is getting a totes adorbs (if pricey) collector’s edition

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
Here's a pretty good look at Aionios
So far what we've seen of Xenoblade Chronicles 3's locations look on point, and this week Nintendo is showing off more of the world of Aionios.
Shared by way of Nintendo's YouTube account (and Twitter), at least one zone has the classic Xenoblade look and feel of a lush water-filled environment (similar to Gaur Plain), and "Aionios" itself is most definitely appropriate nomenclature for a Xenoblade universe. As a reminder, Nintendo describes Aionios as "the rich world where you’ll begin your journey to end the cycle of violence between two opposing nations in Xenoblade Chronicles 3." Those two nations are Agnus and Keves. Through the clip below, we're able to get a glimpse at some of the verticality of exploration, some teases into a few structures that will likely have story ramifications, and of course, several enemy designs.
For me, it's hard for the team to really top Satorl Marsh from the first game. It's such a gorgeous area and it's the first thing I think of when I hear the phrase "Xenoblade Chronicles." Walking through it was a joy in the original and made me recall some of the best zones from '90s JRPGs, and going back through it in the Switch edition was a treat.
Xenoblade Chronicles 3 locations trailer:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G5w6ANGPFTw
The post Leave it to Xenoblade Chronicles 3 to deliver more beautiful locations appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Leave it to Xenoblade Chronicles 3 to deliver more beautiful locations

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
I wonder who will play him in the third movie
It's not often that I get to talk about Shadow the Hedgehog, so I'll definitely take this opportunity and run with it.
Like Waluigi (albeit less lovingly so), Shadow is often seen as an oddity of the universe he's in, especially given his insane backstory and penchant for using guns. When juxtaposed to Sonic and most of his "friends," he sticks out like a sore thumb. His polarizing reaction really doesn't need an introduction.
But like all black sheep, he has a legion of fans, and his edgelord nature has been used to great effect in some Sonic media. One of my favorite semi-recent takes was Shadow showing up in the otherwise goofy Sonic Boom as a serious character, only to have Robotnik refer to him as a "fan favorite" and talk about how much p…
articles.title: This professional voice actor goes for it with a Shadow the Hedgehog audition

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
A shiny new look for Days Gone devs
Bend Studio, the Sony subsidiary behind survival horror wilderness title Days Gone, announced that it has started development on a brand new project — one that it hopes will advance the open-world adventure, excitement, and engagement of its aforementioned monster-bashing biker epic.
"We are currently working on a new IP that includes multiplayer and builds upon the open-world systems of Days Gone, but brings you a whole new world that we are extremely excited to craft for you," said community manager Kevin McAllister in comments to PlayStation Blog. "We cannot wait to reveal it to you when the time is right."
The comments come almost a year to the day that Bend Studio announced it would venture into new IP territory for its next project, news that came as something of a consolation prize to the controversial story that a Days Gone sequel was canned by Sony, despite the team feeling very passionate toward the idea of creating one. As I said at the time, you sometimes have to "do the thing to do the thing", and if Bend delivers a major hit for Sony with this new project, then perhaps the parent company will see to making Days Gone 2 a reality.
In related news, Bend Studio also revealed its new branding, complete with a snazzy new logo. The company has opened up numerous job listings for a wide variety of designers, coders, artists, and animators. You can check out the vacancies over on the official Bend Studio website.
The post Bend Studio begins development of new open-world, multiplayer project appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Bend Studio begins development of new open-world, multiplayer project

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
The animated tease is the most interesting part so far
So the unveiling of Sonic Frontiers gameplay didn't really go as planned for Sega, but they did tease an interesting departure from the open world formula: animated story sequences. Thanks to a new Sonic Central stream, we got a small tease of Sonic Frontiers story details.
There's two teases afoot, actually, both in the same day. One comes from the latest IGN video, which provides a snippet of the story:
"After flying into a wormhole with Tails and Amy, Sonic finds himself separated from his friends and all alone on an isolated island, with nothing but an AI voice guiding him to collect the Chaos Emeralds."

So the obvious takeaways here are that Tails and Amy are a part of Frontiers, and that we possibly won't get an overload of "friends." Remember the tenuous original story tidbit shared by Sega back during the announcement, too, which was subsequently removed from Polygon's report due to Sega deeming it "incorrect:"
"In Sonic Frontiers, Sonic’s long-time nemesis Dr. Eggman discovers an ancient technology on the Starfall Islands and installs his AI program SAGE to hack in and take over. But there is more to this technology than he realizes, and unintended consequences immediately come to bear. Sonic must race against time to discover the truth, save his friends, and maybe even save himself at the same time."

The second recent tease comes via a short clip in the Sonic Central stream that's literally just a few seconds, we see Knuckles at the top of the stairs seemingly guarding an emerald [probably the master]. The full short will be shared "later this year, prior to the release of Sonic Frontiers." Remember, this story will be penned by Sonic comic writer Ian Flynn, and right now, it's the most intriguing part of this new entry.
The post We got our first glimpse into the story of Sonic Frontiers appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: We got our first glimpse into the story of Sonic Frontiers

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
Tomorrow comes for those who wait
The surreal community survival experience The Tomorrow Children returns to PlayStation later this year. Q-Games will launch The Tomorrow Children: Phoenix Edition for PS4 and PS5 in 2022.
The Tomorrow Children first launched in 2016, in partnership with Sony Interactive Entertainment. Yet one year later, the online social action game closed its doors.
In the time since, Q-Games has reacquired the IP of The Tomorrow Children, and now looks to relaunch its game for both a new and returning audience as The Tomorrow Children: Phoenix Edition.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YqIOo1E-UfY
The Tomorrow Children: Phoenix Edition is set to arrive on PS4 and PS5, with some PlayStation 5-specific enhancements.
Building a new tomorrow
The day-to-day of The Tomorrow Chi…
articles.title: The Tomorrow Children: Phoenix Edition launches later this year on PlayStation

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
Back to the farm
Nintendo has been struggling to provide Switch Online perks to users for some time, but one such perk is occasional game trials: sparing preview versions of full games during certain windows. The next one will be a Stardew Valley Switch Online trial, limited to Australia, Europe, and Japan currently.
With my European and Japanese Switch accounts (they're helpful for reporting!), I was able to see the notification in the "news" sections at the bottom of the Switch UI. The trial will run from June 13 (12:00 JST) through June 19 (17:59 JST). Australia even has an eShop page up for it.
If you somehow haven't played Stardew Valley yet, now is the time, provided you're able to take part in the trial. It's tough to really put into words how magical this game is that hasn't already been said, but suffice to say a few hours with it should give you a clue as to whether or not you're going to be spending another 100 hours with it.
Also note that you should be able to take advantage of the extra My Nintendo mission points once the trial is live. As a reminder, if you want physical rewards, you can find our full Platinum Point guide here, which has been updated with details on weekly missions: bookmark it for when you need quick points for a reward.
The post The next Switch Online game trial is Stardew Valley, in select regions appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The next Switch Online game trial is Stardew Valley, in select regions

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
A week of tasty tidbits from indie developers
Valve has announced the return of its annual summer tradition, the Steam Next Fest, which will once again offer up a huge selection of trials and demos pulled from a wide variety of incoming indie titles.
From Monday, June 13, Steam users will be able to download and check out "hundreds" of demos free of charge. Valve did not release a full list of the available titles, but a short trailer — which you can check out below — references a huge variety of spunky young developers and publishers, all of whom are no doubt hoping that you will find a few minutes to check out their wares.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gnu-nh4NI0Y
According to the above video's description, the Steam Next Fest trailer spotlights (deep breath) Arksync, BROK the InvestiGator, Cult of the Lamb, Daydream Forgotten Sorrow, Exophobia, Foretales, Gestalt Steam Cinder, Glimmer in Mirror, Harmony's Odyssey, King of the Hat, LEGO Bricktales, Misc. A Tiny Tale, Nine Sols, Eyes in the Dark, Fays Factory, and Ghost Song. Of course, these titles make up just a sliver of the demos that will be spotlit during the event.
Steam Next Fest will end on Monday, June 20, so you have a full seven days to check out as many demos as you choose. As this "non-E3" week is already a pretty busy one in regard to live streams, news, and reveals, it might be hard to find space for "hundreds" of releases, but, hopefully, all interested parties will find at least a few new games to add to your Steam wishlist.
The post Steam Next Fest brings us another bonanza of demos next week appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Steam Next Fest brings us another bonanza of demos next week

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
Should be live any day now
Although it isn't fully live currently, a Fire Emblem: Three Hopes demo popped up on the Nintendo store recently. While it currently errors out if you try and download/access it, the listing clearly points to a demo reveal that will likely happen in the near future, so keep an eye out for it: especially if you pre-ordered already.
Typically, Warriors demos involve several early stages, potential access to the world map, and the ability to free play until a certain point in the game. At that point, you should be able to carry over progress into the full version. So for fans, it should be a meaty dive into what Three Hopes has to offer, and provide a glimpse into the new take on the storyline, as well as any potential gameplay adjustments.
Of course, it'll also be an important showcase for something that's deeply impacted Warriors games, especially on Switch: performance. While some can live with framerate issues, others can't, and Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes demo will need to put its best foot forward if it wants to sell more people on the game leading up to launch. Performance hasn't stopped Omega Force and company before, though!
Again, when it goes live, you'll find it here, or on the eShop proper.
[Update: Nintendo has confirmed that the Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes demo is live as of 10:00AM ET June 8, 2022! You can play through the game's first three chapters, and can carry over progress when it launches. Split-screen two-player co-op is confirmed by Nintendo.]
The post Listing pops up for a Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes demo (Update) appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Listing pops up for a Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes demo (Update)

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
"I think [you] can enjoy the story 100 times more"
Should you play Bayonetta 1 and 2 before 3? Well, you don't have to! But producer Hideki Kamiya thinks you should.
We've been through this before in the past. As recently as four months ago, Kamiya noted that folks who played the original two games would get more out of the threequel, which is still slated for later this year. Now he's taken to Twitter this week to reiterate that this is still his stance.
Here's what he says, roughly translated:
"Somehow I wanted to say this again, but if you are thinking of playing Bayonetta 3, I definitely want you to play Bayonetta 1 and Bayonetta 2 by now ... I think that person can enjoy the story 100 times more."

Kamiya notes that with the second game, he "intentionally created a story where you can play it in any order" and not be too lost. But with Bayonetta 3, he worked on the story in such a way that he assumes enough people are aware of the series to have played it, and wanted to make the world-building elements "more profound" with that background informing the audience. He goes on to share this "introductory video" of the first two games (which is in Japanese).
Naturally, if Bayonetta 3 is anything like its predecessors, it'll stand on its own two feet as an action game, even if you skip the entire story. But I really want to see what the third game has up its sleeve now that we have a full-on universe on our hands at this point.
Kamiya answers the question: "Should you play Bayonetta 1 and 2 before 3?"
https://twitter.com/PG_kamiya/status/1534005515432660994
The post Kamiya once again urges folks to play Bayonetta 1 and 2 before 3 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Kamiya once again urges folks to play Bayonetta 1 and 2 before 3

articles.author: Jordan Devore
articles.description:
They've still got it
While we wait for the next entry in the Dark Pictures Anthology, Supermassive Games is dishing out even more choice-based horror in its familiar cinematic style. And this time, it's the big one — the moment fans have been waiting for since Until Dawn. From the outset, The Quarry tries to recapture that lightning in a bottle in terms of scope, story, and execution, and this supernatural end-of-summer-camp adventure hits the mark.
Evil is afoot, and your decisions will once again dictate who makes it to sunrise.

The Quarry (PC [reviewed], PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S)

The Quarry is a standalone new IP — it doesn't belong to Bandai Namco's Dark Pictures series — but there are so many shared traits. And the refinements are stacking up.
If you've been on any of Sup…
articles.title: Review: The Quarry

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
The not-so-Nice Guys
In a week expected to be jam-packed with rumors and leaks, the loudest whispers of the past 24 hours concern Metal Gear creator Hideo Kojima and his studio, Kojima Productions — according to the word around town, the studio is preparing to reveal a brand new horror title, going by the name of "Overdose."
The rumor was sparked by professional spoiler Tom Henderson, who has an uncanny knack for being very right in these matters. Writing on Try Hard Guides, Henderson claims to have already seen the first teaser trailer for Overdose, which sees a young woman — played by Margaret Qualley of Death Stranding, The Nice Guys, and Once Upon a Time in Hollywood — picking her way through a creepy corridor by torchlight.
While this remains a mere rumor at present, Henderson's word has been proven correct on numerous occasions. In fact, (as noted by VGC) Henderson has gone on to claim that Kojima Productions has directly requested the removal of his words, in a tweet that has itself been removed. If Kojima and pals are preparing to reveal Overdose, then one would surmise that we can see it during this season's gaming news digest — perhaps during Thursday's Summer Game Fest, hosted by Kojima's speed-dial buddy Geoff Keighley.
Either way, it's exciting news, people have been linking Hideo Kojima to horror for many years, (lest we forget P.T.), and he has already proven he knows his way around a creepy character or two in the Metal Gear and Death Stranding titles. If Overdose exists, then it could prove to be the realization of the scary, Silent Hill-type adventure that has eluded the studio thus far.
The post Rumor: Kojima Productions set to reveal new horror title Overdose appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Rumor: Kojima Productions set to reveal new horror title Overdose

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
Meet Apollo, the god of music
Hades is one of my favorite games of all time. It was my go-to game at the start of the pandemic, and after all was said and done I think I put close to 400 hours into that bad boy. I have played and replayed Hades to death, so anything new to help switch it up is a welcome change. Enter Apollo — the Greek god of music who was left off of the game's original lineup, but has since been added to the game by way of a mod thanks to AlexKage's project, OlympusExtra, which was originally spotted by ResetEra.
The mod adds Apollo to the game as if he were just like any of the other gods, including Boons (solo and duo), a Keepsake, a Wrath (you know, the environmental attack the gods spring on you when you're in a two-Boon chamber), and of course, plenty of dialogue. An artist named Reikiix did Apollo's portrait, which honestly looks so good you can't tell that it wasn't part of the base game.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IbeHCKiDB7M
Apollo's specialty is a blinding effect, which makes enemies more likely to miss their attacks. I can imagine that would go really well with Aphrodite or Athena's Boons if you want to go for a low-damage or even no-hit run. There are already some videos out there of modders playing with the Apollo mod, so those might be worth checking out if you want to see what he can do to help Zagreus escape the Underworld.
OlympusExtra is still in its early stages — not only will Apollo's inclusion of the game be more built out in the future with some more voice lines and duo Boons on the way, but other gods will also be added to the mix, including Hera, Hestia, and Hephaestus. Hades has fostered a huge cult following since its release in 2020, and it's great to see the modding community getting in on the action.
The post This Hades mod adds Apollo to the game’s roster of gods appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: This Hades mod adds Apollo to the game’s roster of gods
